page.title: 07THE MUSEUM AT WALTHAM ABBEY
page.content:
The museum opened to the public on the {16th of November, 1981.}It is situated in Sun Street and employs six people.
In one year the museum gets about 1,400 visitors. It gets lots of {Americans,}and a few{Germans.}A lot of school parties also come to visit.
The most valuable item in the museum is a section of panelling dating from Henry V111's time. And the most valuable coin is one dating back to the Viking period. Among the oldest exhibits are some stone age tools and implements.
Some of the exhibits are bought and others are donated.
